subject: Art & Design
title: The Swinging Sixties: Youth Takes Over Fashion
description: Learn The Swinging Sixties: Youth Takes Over Fashion in one minute.

hook.text: Mary Quant's miniskirt shocked the world in 1964. Hemlines went to mid-thigh. Parents were horrified. Youth didn't care.

buildup.text: The 1960s shifted fashion power from Parisian couturiers to London's young designers. Youth culture drove the industry.

discovery.text: Pop art, space race aesthetics, and mod culture influenced fashion: bold patterns, geometric prints, PVC.

climax.text: Twiggy became fashion's first supermodel at 16. The industry learned: youth sells, and it sells fast.

punchline.text: The sixties proved that fashion doesn't trickle down from elites.

quiz.question: How did the 1960s change the power structure of fashion?
options: Youth culture and London street fashion overtook Paris couture
Paris strengthened its dominance over global fashion
Fashion became less accessible to young people
